elements.title: Tragedy by the Sea (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Tragedy by the Sea (pictured) shows a man and a woman standing beside the ocean a few minutes after the couple's young son went missing?

elements.title: the public TV station in Memphis, Tennessee (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Mister Rogers said that Mr. Chuck, the host of a children's show on the public TV station in Memphis, Tennessee, was "truly remarkable" and "achieving things I still struggle to achieve"?

elements.title: Gamze Durmuş (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Gamze Durmuş and her husband were the first referees to officiate a TFF First League match together?

elements.title: Paul Takes the Form of a Mortal Girl (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Paul Takes the Form of a Mortal Girl took 15 years to write?

elements.title: Dom DiSandro (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Dom DiSandro, the Philadelphia Eagles' chief security officer, was ejected from a game for getting into a scuffle with an opposing player?

elements.title: Sasuke vs. Commander (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Sasuke vs. Commander, one of SNK's earlier arcade games, was among the earliest to feature multiple boss fights?

elements.title: Melvin Ramsay (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that physician Melvin Ramsay refuted the suggestion – partially based on the fact more women are affected – that myalgic encephalomyelitis is a form of mass hysteria?

elements.title: Vocalises (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Vocalises by Jānis Ivanovs were said to express "a longing for humanity"?
